abstract: Critics claim re-establishment of diplomatic ties between Cuba and United States has caused more problems than progress; American embargo and lingering cultural and political differences between countries has meant few changes in Cubans' daily lives; Obama administration maintains process will be slow and staggered.
lead_paragraph: The normalization process has proceeded in fits and starts, yielding a handful of concrete accomplishments — most notably, the reopening of embassies in Washington and Havana — and lingering difficulties.

headline.main: Year After Cuba-U.S. Thaw, Obama Says Change Will Take Time
headline.print_headline: Year After Cuba-U.S. Thaw, Obama Says Change Will Take Time

snippet: The normalization process has proceeded in fits and starts, yielding a handful of concrete accomplishments — most notably, the reopening of embassies in Washington and Havana — and lingering difficulties.
